column4: hey guys.  I'm new to ubuntu.  What is the utility that allows you to easily manipulate init files?
like which ones to load at bootup and what runlevel they occur at
what do u mean? what do u want ?
an init script manager, like rc-update from Gentoo
what does it do? i dunno gentoo :(
i think we dont have that on ubuntu: just multiple specific tools
usually it is gedit ;)
I dont want to edit the scripts, just control which ones are going to come up at boot and in what sequence
for instance, I want to stop lm-sensors from coming up at boot
yeah. but we just dont do that on ubuntu. Well, i dont.
so what do you do when you are messing around with stuff?  reboot after every change?
nm, that didn't make sense
but anyway, I need the POWER!
i dont know what is gentoo, buty what is sure is that you wont mess up with a debian system easily.
why do you say that?  I'm pretty sure I could screw it up good if I try
yeah! lol. what i mean is that u can screw it on purpose. fedora screws itself, just like windows for example.
so it does a good job of taking care of itself?  thats good.  I'm on a laptop and I don't want to fuss with it really.  Keep gentoo on the desktop
ubuntu is easy to manage. just dont use Automatix, unless you wanna screw your system
too late
automatix seemed to work alright for me though
I haven't used anything but Gentoo for about 3 years.  The usual normal way is editing all my own configuration files
